comments.body: That would be good. Can we also add custom capes to bedrock? At the moment, you need mods to get capes.

I fully agree, plus they were to add more varieties of capes to Bedrock

This was not added to java in 1.17, it was added in like 1.13 over 3 years ago i believe. But yes i would love to see this in bedrock, because i myself am a late game player and have to spend ungodly hours collecting shulker shells for thousands of shulker boxes. Being able to automate this would be a huge quality of life update for people like me!

I need this so much! I have tons of farms working 24/7 and I need to be able to have much more space without wasting all my wood on chests and hoppers. I do have around 2 stacks of shulker shells but that's not even close to what I need. We *NEED* this feature in bedrock!
Good idea

This literally gives me motion sickness lol

It would be fine to add it in a way where you can toggle the drifting, so even people who want it can be satisfied.
Console users need this too. I mainly build in Creative mode, but I haven’t been able to use the game since they added the drift, it drives me nuts. A way to toggle this off would be a lifesaver.

This would be so helpful

I just got the Minecraft launcher yesterday and after play bedrock for ages, the drifting felt so weird an option to turn it off would be great

Remember in the Xbox 360 era when there was no flying drift? Why add something to the game that is so useless and makes creative building on pc so bad that I have to use bedrock? They need to either get rid of the drift or make it toggleable.
I play on ps4 and the drift is so annoying in creative mode, why did they add this
At least chest placement should not be directional.
Really good idea and if bedrock could have banners on maps actually work like pinpoints

This is a must for multiple farms. faster placing and breaking and being able to show off things is cool too.

Maybe for pocket edition, there is a switch button that will appear when something is in your offhand, and when you press it, it will change which hand will be used, and for controllers, make it one of the d-pad buttons that switch which hand is used.

no
no pls dont

I think it will be an idea to add an option in every settings in the game to turn on or off and have an easy to use vert and revert from 1.8 and 1.9 style pvp so it'll will be less controversy and may be accepted by those prefer to click fast
Only if it's like how the person on the bottom suggested.
They should just do the combat update 2.0 for both versions ASAP.
this is not gonna happen.

I agree that Xbox One Edition should get the aquatic update too just like Nintendo Switch Edition. Xbox One Edition was discontinued in September 2017 however it was later updated again and received TU58 and updates after it but after June 2018 it was completely excluded from all updates, which the other console received. Not releasing the aquatic update to Xbox One and Nintendo Switch because you have the aquatic update on bedrock doesn’t make sense imo. In the aquatic update Console Edition got a new tutorial world, the emrald icon above villagers (and wandering traders on PS4 too later) when trading which was sadly removed from bedrock, faster eye-level change animations (sneaking was fixed on bedrock but when your eye-level changes due to using riptide, swimming or using an elytra it is still too slow on bedrock but on Console Edition it matches Java), animation of camera moving up or down when entering or leaving a bed, properly working tridents (the channeling sound actually plays and loyalty tridents also return upon hitting an entity instead of bouncing off it first) and the sound for diving into and out of water. All of these features are still missing on bedrock, there are probably more. Most of them are also present on Java Edition.
Yes please update Xbox one edition to update aquatic the legacy console editions are much better than Minecraft bedrock the new one isn't the same as legacy editions

I really want this to happen I exclusively play Xbox one edition since my bedrock worlds got deleted because (bedrock edition) and I love the way it runs comperd to bedrock but I wish it had newer updates having 1.13 would be great or even the 1.14 update from ps4 edition. I don't think this will happen but if it dose I will be very happy.

Myself and my friend have always only played on the same world since 2012 or 2013. It was originally built on the 360 version, then imported to the xbox one edition a long time ago when it first came out. If we ever lost this map, it is fair to say we could not bring ourselves to play again. It just has had so much work done on it for a little over a decade. I was absolutely heartbroken to see the version we play was the ONLY version that did not get the aquatic update. Here we are in 2023, still playing on the same world save file. We simply cannot migrate to bedrock because things we have built will not function anymore, and we would lose access to the Halo texture pack that is not offered in the other edition. Seeing all the new content we have been missing out on for years now makes us a bit sad, and I really wish we could at least see the major aquatic update and all the wonderful features be able to be brought into our decade-old save file. It seems like we missed out on quite a lot with this update. I can understand not wanting to support this edition forever, but we cant help but feel disenfranchised being the only edition that was not updated. There is still a community of people who play the xbox one edition, and we really hope to see this one day. But if not, we will continue with what we have.

The console edition of minecraft runs much faster because it doesnt have all of the animations slowing it down. It would be really cool if they would update the console edition exclusively on the xbox a lot because it would end up like a java edition. I also play survival more on the console edition because bedrock doesn't run the same and the console edition has more of a java feel.
